com.jaunt
Class HttpRequest

java.lang.Object
  com.jaunt.HttpRequest

public class HttpRequest
extends java.lang.Object

Represents an Http request.

Since:
0.9.0
Author:
Tom Cervenka

Method Detail

make

public static HttpRequest make(short httpMethod,
                               java.lang.String url,
                               short enctype,
                               MultiMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> nameValuePairs,
                               MultiMap<java.lang.String,java.io.File> nameFilePairs,
                               java.lang.String content,
                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> additionalHeaders)
Creates and returns an HTTP request.

Parameters:
httpMethod - an httpRequest method type constant (eg, HttpRequest.TYPE_GET).
url - the fully qualified url to which the request will be sent (the url may contain a query String, however if the nameValuePairs parameter is passed in, those values with be used to construct the queryString instead).
enctype - an enctype constant (GET requests and most POST requests should be ENCTYPE_APPLICATION_X_WWW_FORM_URLENCODED; POST requests that involve file uploads should be ENCTYPE_MULTIPART_FORM_DATA; HEAD, DELETE and PUT requests should be ENCTYPE_NA)
nameValuePairs - a MultiMap of name-value pairs (ie form field data) or null; each name (key) can be associated with one or more values; the values should be url-encoded if creating a request of who's enctype is ENCTYPE_APPLICATION_X_WWW_FORM_URLENCODED
nameFilePairs - a MultiMap of name-file pairs to be uploaded or null.
additionalHeaders - a Map of header names and header values for this request (which are added-to or override the auto-managed headers [eg cookies, referer, etc] as well as the headers specified in UserAgent.settings.defaultRequestHeaders); can be null

makeGET

public static HttpRequest makeGET(java.lang.String url,
                                  MultiMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> nameValuePairs,
                                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> additionalHeaders)
Creates and returns a GET HttpRequest.

Parameters:
url - the fully qualified url to which the request will be sent (the url may contain a query String, however if the nameValuePairs parameter is passed in, those values with be used to construct the queryString instead).
nameValuePairs - a MultiMap of name-value pairs (ie form field data) or null; each name (key) can be associated with one or more values; the values should be url-encoded.
additionalHeaders - a Map of header names and header values for this request (which are added-to or override the auto-managed headers [eg cookies, referer, etc] as well as the headers specified in UserAgent.settings.defaultRequestHeaders); can be null

makeGET

public static HttpRequest makeGET(java.lang.String url)
Creates and returns a GET HttpRequest.

Parameters:
url - the fully qualified url to which the request will be sent (the url may contain a query String).

makePOST

public static HttpRequest makePOST(java.lang.String url,
                                   short enctype,
                                   MultiMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> nameValuePairs,
                                   MultiMap<java.lang.String,java.io.File> nameFilePairs,
                                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> additionalHeaders)
Creates and returns a POST HttpRequest.

Parameters:
url - the fully qualified url to which the request will be sent.
enctype - an enctype constant of HttpRequest (POST requests that involve file uploads must be ENCTYPE_MULTIPART_FORM_DATA, otherwise they may be ENCTYPE_APPLICATION_X_WWW_FORM_URLENCODED)
nameValuePairs - a MultiMap of name-value pairs (ie form field data) or null; each name (key) can be associated with one or more values; the values should be url-encoded if the encyType parameter is ENCTYPE_APPLICATION_X_WWW_FORM_URLENCODED
nameFilePairs - a MultiMap of name-file pairs to be uploaded or null.
additionalHeaders - a Map of header names and header values for this request (which are added-to or override the auto-managed headers [eg cookies, referer, etc] as well as the headers specified in UserAgent.settings.defaultRequestHeaders); can be null

makePOST

public static HttpRequest makePOST(java.lang.String url,
                                   MultiMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> nameValuePairs)
Creates and returns a POST HttpRequest.

Parameters:
url - the fully qualified url to which the request will be sent.
nameValuePairs - a MultiMap of name-value pairs (ie form field data) or null; each name (key) can be associated with one or more values; the values should be url-encoded.

makePUT

public static HttpRequest makePUT(java.lang.String url,
                                  java.lang.String content,
                                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> additionalHeaders)
Creates and returns a PUT HttpRequest.

Parameters:
url - the fully qualified url to which the request will be sent.
content - the content body or null.
additionalHeaders - a Map of header names and header values for this request (which are added-to or override the auto-managed headers [eg cookies, referer, etc] as well as the headers specified in UserAgent.settings.defaultRequestHeaders); can be null

makePUT

public static HttpRequest makePUT(java.lang.String url,
                                  java.lang.String content)
Creates and returns a PUT HttpRequest.

Parameters:
url - the fully qualified url to which the request will be sent.
content - the content body or null.

                                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> additionalHeaders)

Parameters:
url - the fully qualified url to which the request will be sent.
additionalHeaders - a Map of header names and header values for this request (which are added-to or override the auto-managed headers [eg cookies, referer, etc] as well as the headers specified in UserAgent.settings.defaultRequestHeaders); can be null

getNameFilePairs

setNameValuePair

public void setNameValuePair(java.lang.String name,
                             java.lang.String value)
Adds the specified name and value, removing any other values associated with the specified name, irrespective of the case of the name; the added values should be url-encoded if creating a request of who's enctype is ENCTYPE_APPLICATION_X_WWW_FORM_URLENCODED.

Parameters:
value - the url-encoded value, which should be encoded (eg using java.net.URLEncoder.encode).

addNameValuePair

public void addNameValuePair(java.lang.String name,
                             java.lang.String value)
Adds the specified (case sensitive) name and value; the added values should be url-encoded if creating a request of who's enctype is ENCTYPE_APPLICATION_X_WWW_FORM_URLENCODED

Parameters:
value - the url-encoded value, which should be encoded (eg using java.net.URLEncoder.encode).

removeNameValuePairs

public void removeNameValuePairs(java.lang.String name)
Removes all values associated with the specified (case insensitive) name from the collection of name-value pairs.

getNameValuePairs

public MultiMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getNameValuePairs()
Returns a MultiMap of name-value pairs, where each name can be associated with multiple values.
